description_txt: stated on December 1, 2010 in a press release:
quote_txt: "A 5 percent increase in domestic production would increase the world supply by less than 1 percent and do almost nothing to our dependence on foreign oil. This would also have virtually no effect on the price of gas at the pump."

description_txt: stated on December 3, 2010 in a news release:
quote_txt: "I have always been focused on reining in the deficit."

description_txt: stated on December 9, 2010 in a newsletter:
quote_txt: Says Joe Straus "was co-author of a bill that would have allowed Planned Parenthood to control public school sex education."

description_txt: stated on December 7, 2010 in a news release:
quote_txt: Says Jim Renacci ran against the Washington establishment in the election, but is now "hypocritically embracing it with big money, special interest fundraisers."

description_txt: stated on November 30, 2010 in a presentation:
quote_txt: "Sixteen [federal] programs exist to fight homelessness" and some of them are duplicative.

description_txt: stated on December 5, 2010 in a TV interview:
quote_txt: State employees in Wisconsin earn "about 8 percent less" than if they worked in the private sector.

description_txt: stated on December 3, 2010 in an interview:
quote_txt: Says federal health care overhaul will cost Texas state government "upwards of $30 billion over the next 10 years."

description_txt: stated on December 2, 2010 in a Providence Journal story:
quote_txt: Rhode Island spends less than 10 percent of what the average state spends promoting tourism.
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • December 12, 2010

description_txt: stated on December 2, 2010 in a news release.:
quote_txt: The Bush-era tax cuts failed to increase employment and "work-force participation fell in 2001 and has never returned to the record level set in 2000."

description_txt: stated on June 11, 2010 in an interview.:
quote_txt: You "can't check out a library book without a photo ID."

description_txt: stated on November 30, 2010 in a Senate floor speech:
quote_txt: "Last year, ExxonMobil made $19 billion in profit. Guess what. They paid zero in taxes. They got a $156 million refund from the IRS."

description_txt: stated on December 8, 2010 in comments to a newspaper.:
quote_txt: The state has "less employees this year than we did last year."

description_txt: stated on November 30, 2010 in a Senate floor speech:
quote_txt: In 2007, "the top 1 percent of all income earners in the United States made 23.5 percent of all income," which is "more than the entire bottom 50 percent."

description_txt: stated on December 9, 2010 in a statement on campaign web site:
quote_txt: Eliminating the state tax on health savings accounts will "make it easier for small business owners to provide health insurance to their employees."

description_txt: stated on December 5, 2010 in a newspaper ad:
quote_txt: Oregonians have an "amazing no-cost way to fight abortion" with free political donations

description_txt: stated on December 5, 2010 in the TV show's season finale:
quote_txt: In the case of a catastrophic event, the Atlanta-area offices of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention will self-destruct.

description_txt: stated on December 6, 2010 in a press release.:
quote_txt: "An overwhelming majority of Americans support passage of the DREAM Act, which would provide a path to citizenship for undocumented youth willing to work for a college degree or serve in our armed forces."

description_txt: stated on December 3, 2010 in a gathering with reporters:
quote_txt: "I think [a little] less than half of the people in our prisons are in there for less than a year.  ... We have people who are check kiters and don't pay child support and we are locking them up in the state pen."

description_txt: stated on November 18, 2010 in blog postings:
quote_txt: Sheldon Whitehouse and 18 other senators "voted to censor the internet."

description_txt: stated on November 18, 2010 in a speech:
quote_txt: "The cost-saving measures we put into place at Columbia/HCA drove down national health care inflation from 18% to 8% in seven years."

description_txt: stated on November 18, 2010 in a Senate floor speech:
quote_txt: There are "10 or 20 deaths a year from foodborne illness" in the United States.

description_txt: stated on December 6, 2010 in a floor speech.:
quote_txt: The national debt grew an estimated $15 billion last weekend.

description_txt: stated on December 5, 2010 in a television interview:
quote_txt: When it comes to the state deficit, Wisconsin is "proportionally in as much trouble as the State of California."

description_txt: stated on December 1, 2010 in a city council meeting:
quote_txt: Cities like Seattle have decided to ban food carts.

description_txt: stated on November 16, 2010 in a news conference:
quote_txt: "Ohio is losing over 700 family farms a year, some of them just to pay the inheritance tax."

description_txt: stated on December 7, 2010 in a meeting of the Florida Cabinet:
quote_txt: "150,000 (oil spill) claims have been filed by Floridians, but only 40 percent of them have been paid."

description_txt: stated on December 7, 2010 in a press conference:
quote_txt: When President Franklin D. Roosevelt started Social Security, "it only affected widows and orphans," and when Medicare began, "it was a small program."

description_txt: stated on November 21, 2010 in TV interview:
quote_txt: The U.S. "had the opportunity with Israel coming and talking to us about improving our security screening procedures, and we turned them down."

description_txt: stated on December 2, 2010 in an opinion piece:
quote_txt: Under the DREAM Act, after two years of higher education or military service "you are eligible for citizenship. Once a citizen, this paves the way to bring the rest of (your) extended family to the United States."

description_txt: stated on November 19, 2010 in a CNN interview:
quote_txt: "They tried to give us $400 million to build a high-speed train that goes 39 miles an hour."
